Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and label it as a living thing.
The student can include water as the habitat for the fish and label it.
The student can draw and label other parts of the habitat like plants or rocks that might be in or around the water.
The student can show and label the resources the fish needs from its habitat (like water and possibly other fish or plants).
The student can illustrate and label how the habitat provides what the fish needs to survive (such as space to swim and food to eat).
The student can connect and label the idea that the fish, water, plants, and rocks are all part of a larger system where everything works together.
